title: compile for linux from windows
body:
by **milak.mlk**: 
Id like to compile in my windows 7 64 a binary for linux 32.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1.change GOARCH=386
2.change GOOS=linux
3.go build ...

What is the expected output?
compile my program for linux

What do you see instead?
go build runtime: exec:
"B:\\Programmes\\programmation\\go\\pkg\\tool\\windows_amd64\\8g.exe":
GetFileAttributesEx B:\Programmes\programmation\go\pkg\tool\windows_amd64\8g.exe: winapi
error #2

Except for the strange error message, it indicates that 8g.exe doesn't exist. It is
true. Is there a way to get these files ? I mean 8g.exe, 8l.exe, etc.

Which operating system are you using?
windows 7 64 bits

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
1.0.3

Please provide any additional information below.
This program compiles with the default values
